# Theme / Color Palette (extracted)

This file summarizes the semantic CSS variables and the literal colors found in the project so the assistant "remembers" the page color scheme.

## Semantic variables (defined in `src/index.css`)
- --background: oklch(1 0 0)  (light) / oklch(0.145 0 0) (.dark)
- --foreground: oklch(0.145 0 0) (light) / oklch(0.985 0 0) (.dark)
- --card / --card-foreground
- --popover / --popover-foreground
- --primary: oklch(0.205 0 0) (light) / oklch(0.922 0 0) (.dark)
- --primary-foreground: oklch(0.985 0 0) (light) / oklch(0.205 0 0) (.dark)
- --secondary, --muted, --accent (oklch values)
- --destructive, --border, --input, --ring
- chart colors: --chart-1 .. --chart-5

These variables are used across the app; many components reference them via the `--color-*` aliases.

## Literal colors found in components/CSS (commonly used)
- #5227FF — purple (DotGrid active / base color)
- #060010 — very dark purple / overlay blur fallback (DomeGallery)
- #bb4d00 — orange (DomeGallery button background)
- #fff / #ffffff — white (text, UI)
- #151515 — dark text color used for animated text (#text-anim)
- #0c33f5 — bright blue (used in text-shadow / glitches)
- lime (named) — used in text-shadow animations
- red (named) — used in text-shadow animations
- #231b17 — deep brown / near-black (used as small accent bg)
- #564b45ca — hex-with-alpha used in Tailwind-like classes (semi-opaque brown)
- #e3b2b3 — pale pink (text / hover accents)
- #100A06 — near-black background (Navbar)
- #47403c — muted brown/gray (borders)
- #222 — dark gray (text in some components)

Notes:
- The project uses a semantic theme based on CSS variables (oklch color space) with a dark mode `.dark` override. For consistent changes, prefer editing the variables in `src/index.css` rather than replacing literal hex values in components.
- There are some named colors (red, lime) used in keyframe animations; those are intentionally generic.

If you'd like, I can:
- Replace repeated literal colors with CSS variables for consistency.
- Create a `src/theme.js` or `src/theme.css` exporting the semantic palette for JS usage.
